sources.title: Doughboys(1930)- I Want My Mama(Buster Keaton, Cliff Edwards)
sources.description: Buster Keaton, with “Ukelele Ike” Cliff Edwards, reeling off an un-credited vaudeville tune, in Keaton’s second MGM talkie, Doughboys, 1930.

metadata.Plot: Elmer, rich society loafer, falls for Mary, but she'll have nothing to do with him until (mistakenly thinking that he's hiring a new chauffeur) he accidentally volunteers for the army. Luckily, Mary's signed up to entertain the troops. Unluckily, Elmer's sergeant likes Mary, too. And worst of all, they're all about to ship out for France.
metadata.Writer: Al Boasberg, Sidney Lazarus, Richard Schayer
metadata.Actors: Buster Keaton, Sally Eilers, Cliff Edwards
